meanings.definition: In a way that is of doubtful authenticity or authorship.
meanings.sent1: She apocryphally claimed to have seen a UFO last night.
meanings.sent2: The old book was apocryphally attributed to Shakespeare.
meanings.sent3: The cat apocryphally insisted it was the one who knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: His apocryphally tall tales always entertained us at parties.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious figure vanished apocryphally into the fog.

meanings.definition: According to a story or account of doubtful authenticity.
meanings.sent1: The apocryphally ancient artifact puzzled the archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: She shared an apocryphally interesting legend about the haunted house.
meanings.sent3: The apocryphally haunted house turned out to be a prank by the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: His apocryphally charming smile won her over instantly.
meanings.sent5: The apocryphally rare flower bloomed only once a year.
